Leah_Wander_GrandpaShrine_4: You ever talk to him? Your grandpa?#$b#I do sometimes. Just little things. Thanking him, mostly.
Leah_Wander_GrandpaShrine_5: I was just standing here, feeling grateful. To your grandpa, for leaving you this place.#$b#And to you... for being brave enough to come here, so I could find you.$4
Leah_Wander_GrandpaShrine_6: I wonder if your grandpa knew you'd turn this overgrown land into... well, this.#$b#And that you'd pick up a stray artist along the way.$4
Leah_Wander_GrandpaShrine_7: I sometimes get the feeling your grandpa's still watching over the farm.#$b#Don't worry, I told him I'm taking very good care of his ${grandson^granddaughter}$.$4
Leah_Wander_GrandpaShrine_8: This spot makes me think about roots. Not just plants... ours too. All the quiet choices that brought us here.#$b#I wouldn't change a single one.

Leah_Wander_GrandpaShrine_10: Do you think he visits? Like, spiritually?#$b#I'm not usually superstitious, but this shrine... there's definitely something here.
Leah_Wander_GrandpaShrine_11: I've been coming here to think lately. It's peaceful, but there's also this energy...#$e#Sometimes I swear I can smell pipe tobacco on the breeze. Weird, huh?
Leah_Wander_GrandpaShrine_12: $z leah_draw#Sometimes when I'm sketching here, I imagine conversations with your grandpa. Is that strange?#$b#I tell him about you, mostly. How happy you make me.$4
Leah_Wander_GrandpaShrine_13: You get a certain look on your face when you come up here. A little thoughtful, a little distant...#$b#He'd be so proud of you, you know. I know I am.$4
Leah_Wander_GrandpaShrine_14: Do you think he'd have liked me?#$b#Your grandfather, I mean.$3#$b#Sorry, that's probably a silly question... But I find myself wondering sometimes.
Leah_Wander_GrandpaShrine_15: I like to imagine that your grandfather knew someday you'd find me... or I'd find you.$4#$b#That sounds terribly romantic, doesn't it? Maybe Elliott is rubbing off on me.$1
Leah_Wander_GrandpaShrine_16: I used to think living in the wilderness was about escaping people. Now I realize it's about connecting to something deeper.#$b#Your grandfather understood that, I think. That's why he wanted you to come back here.
